    • cannotBeConsecutiveMarketDays

      public static boolean cannotBeConsecutiveMarketDays​(java.time.LocalDate date, java.time.LocalDate nextMarketDate)
      This is for the cases where we don't have a Market object to help us validate that we have two consecutive market dates. These checks should catch most problems, such as to check that it's not more than 7 calendar days out into the future. We use 7 to catch corner cases such as 9/11, when the market was closed for many consecutive days.

    • findNthDay

      public static java.util.Optional<java.time.LocalDate> findNthDay​(java.time.YearMonth yearMonth, int n, java.time.DayOfWeek dayOfWeek)
      Helps to find e.g. the 3rd Monday in February 2019. n = 1 means first e.g. Monday in YearMonth - so n starts at 1 instead of 0

    • getNearestWeekday

      public static java.time.LocalDate getNearestWeekday​(java.time.LocalDate date)
      If supplied date is on a weekend, return the nearest weekday (Fri if Sat was supplied, Mon if Sun was supplied). Otherwise, return the same date.

    • parseValidYear

      public static java.time.Year parseValidYear​(java.lang.String asYear)

    • checkYearIsReasonable
